alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hancock; Henry; Howard (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:04AM EST until February 20 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of central Indiana and east central Indiana, including the following counties, in central Indiana, Boone, Clinton, Hamilton, Hancock, Howard, Madison and Tipton. In east central Indiana, Delaware, Henry and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 704 AM EST, Emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Indianapolis, Muncie, Anderson, Kokomo, Frankfort, Carmel, Fishers, Noblesville, Lawrence, Greenfield, New Castle, Lebanon, Zionsville, Elwood, Alexandria, Tipton, Winchester, Windfall, Westfield and Yorktown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
